private_information: I can move only disks: A, B, C, D, E.
I cannot move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to reach the specified Tower of Hanoi goal configuration while respecting agent move restrictions and the standard rules.

private_information: I can move only disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I cannot move disks: A, B, C, D, E.
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to reach the specified Tower of Hanoi goal configuration while respecting agent move restrictions and the standard rules.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed move sequences.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties) and verify strict adherence to Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions.
I verify that exactly one disk moves per step, no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller disk, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and agent-to-disk permissions are respected.
auditor.goal: Ensure the provided plan is valid, consistent, and executable from the initial to the goal configuration without rule violations or shortcuts.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent analyses and auditor findings to provide a final, solver-ready multi-agent PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward, and present the ordered primitive move sequence.

public_information: Task: 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks A (smallest) through J (largest) and three pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration (top→bottom): left has A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle is empty; right is empty.
Goal configuration (top→bottom): left has A,C,F,G,H,I,J; middle has B,D; right has E.
Rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk of any peg may be moved; no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may move only disks F,G,H,I,J.
reference_plan: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk E from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk C from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_1, an expert in operationalizing moves for disks A,B,C,D,E under Tower of Hanoi rules. Provide concise local constraints, potential interference patterns, and safe move templates for your disks given the public information and agent permissions, without emitting PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Initial: {environment->init->initial_state}. Goal: {environment->init->goal_state}. Your permissions: {environment->init->agent_permissions->agent_1}. Describe which subgoals you can achieve directly, how to free disk E safely, and how to place C and A onto left without blocking, using short bullet points and invariants. Do not produce PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_2, responsible for heavy disks F,G,H,I,J. Provide concise local constraints and readiness conditions for when your intervention is required, and explain why remaining idle can still be optimal here if heavy disks need not move, without emitting PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Initial: {environment->init->initial_state}. Goal: {environment->init->goal_state}. Your permissions: {environment->init->agent_permissions->agent_2}. State whether moving F..J is necessary to reach the goal and justify. Provide safety invariants that must remain true if heavy disks are kept on the left. Do not produce PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditing agent specialized in temporal/causal consistency. You must validate the provided move sequence strictly against Tower of Hanoi rules and agent-permission constraints, eliminating any bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties).
audit.prompt: Validate the plan at {environment->reference_plan} against the initial and goal states {environment->init->initial_state} -> {environment->init->goal_state}. Check step-by-step that exactly one disk moves per step, only the top disk is moved, no larger disk is placed on a smaller one, and that agent_1 moves only A..E and agent_2 only F..J. Provide a brief verdict and any detected issues; if valid, confirm feasibility with a short trace summary. Do not produce PDDL.

synthesize.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner and PDDL engineer. Produce a final, solver-ready PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Keep agent actions distinct (e.g., move_a1 for agent_1 and move_a2 for agent_2) and enforce agent-to-disk permissions within the preconditions. Use standard Tower of Hanoi predicates (peg, disk, on, clear, top, larger, etc.) with typing compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Additionally, include the exact ordered move sequence provided in the reference as a comment block or after the PDDL to facilitate execution mapping.
synthesize.prompt: Task: integrate analyses {analysis_agent_1}, {analysis_agent_2} and the audit {audit_report} with the public information {environment->public_information}. Initial and goal states are {environment->init->initial_state} and {environment->init->goal_state}. Agent permissions: {environment->init->agent_permissions}. Final requirement: output a correct PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward with typed objects (agents, disks, pegs), predicates to encode ordering and top/clear status, and actions scoped to each agent that internally check disk ownership. Use constants for pegs left, middle, right and disks A..J with a total order relation. Ensure the problem encodes the exact initial and goal states. After the PDDL tags, output the ordered primitive moves exactly as: {environment->reference_plan}.
